course_title: Methods for Literary Research: Contemporary Poetry & Archive
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Complete Topic: The Contemporary Poetry & the Archive
This course will introduce students to theories and politics of archival recovery, conservation, and provenance through discussion and Special Collections workshops with a focus on poetry, little magazines, broadsides, and ephemera housed in The Raymond Danowski Poetry Library and Stuart A. Rose Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library.  In addition to examining the Danowski collection of American Beat poetics, the course will feature hands-on experience with Emory's expansive holdings of manuscripts and correspondence for figures such as Alice Walker and Lucille Clifton.
course_description: This course introduces students to the methods and materials of academic literary research and criticism. Focusing on a small body of literature and scholarship within one area of study, the course will teach students to engage with secondary sources, including contextual and/or archival material.
sections: Class Nbr: 2116, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: W. Kalaidjian, Status: Wait List
